item.title: 克罗格计划为 Albertsons 交易出售至少 7 期债券
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger Co.）准备出售至少七个部分的投资级债券，以帮助为其收购同类杂货商阿尔伯森公司（Albertsons Cos.）的计划提供资金，因为反垄断审查继续笼罩着该计划。【原文：Kroger Co. is poised to sell investment-grade bonds in at least seven parts to help fund its proposed acquisition of fellow grocer Albertsons Cos. as antitrust scrutiny continues to hang over the plan.】

item.title: 德国上半年对华出口低于对波兰的出口
item.description: 今年上半年，德国出口商运往波兰的产品多于运往中国的产品，这表明德国正努力使贸易多样化，摆脱世界第二大经济体的影响，并加强与国内的关系。【原文：German exporters shipped more products to Poland than to China in the first half of the year, underscoring Germany’s efforts to diversify trade away from the world’s second-largest economy and enhance relationships closer to home.】

item.title: 苏丹和谈将继续在瑞士举行，军队仍未出席
item.description: 由美国斡旋的旨在结束苏丹内战的会谈将在瑞士继续进行，至少到本周末结束，但说服军队代表亲自参加会谈的努力至今未果，这使达成协议的努力受挫。【原文：US-brokered talks aimed at ending Sudan’s civil war are set to continue in Switzerland until at least the end of this week, but efforts to persuade army representatives to attend in person have failed so far, frustrating efforts to reach a deal.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金因全球市场反弹而收益颇丰
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金称，受本地投资和国际投资组合收益的推动，该基金去年的回报率有所上升。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund said returns rose last year driven by local investments and gains on its international portfolio.】

item.title: 杰富瑞领导的银行集团为标签制造商提供更优惠的贷款条件
item.description: 以杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc）为首的一批银行对 M2S Group Intermediate Holdings Inc.【原文：A group of banks led by Jefferies Financial Group Inc. has sweetened the terms on a proposed $870 million leveraged loan for M2S Group Intermediate Holdings Inc. that failed to price as planned earlier this month.】

item.title: 土耳其国家银行在利率会议前出手提振里拉
item.description: 土耳其国家贷款机构抛售美元以支撑里拉，因为在中央银行召开利率会议之前，里拉继续逐步下跌。【原文：Turkish state lenders sold dollars to support the lira as the currency’s gradual decline continued ahead of the central bank’s rate meeting.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州干旱迫使小镇拖欠供水系统债务
item.description: 得克萨斯州的持续干旱损害了一个小镇的财政，使其无法向债券持有人支付债券，这是罕见的与气候有关的违约事件。【原文：A persistent drought in Texas is hurting the finances of a small town, making it unable to pay bondholders in a rare instance of climate-related default.】

item.title: 销售额创五年新低，美国 ESG 债券市场面临缓慢死亡
item.description: 债券本应改变世界。美国公司和银行对出售债券越来越不感兴趣。【原文：The bonds were supposed to change the world. US companies and banks are increasingly uninterested in selling them.】

item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Momentum traders and a surge in corporate buybacks promise to drive a US stocks rally over the next four weeks, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 索马里商人停业抗议国际货币基金组织支持的销售税
item.description: 周一，索马里的商业活动连续第二天中断，因为商人们抗议征收销售税，这是非洲之角国家政府从国际货币基金组织获得 1 亿美元生命线的一项关键改革。【原文：Commerce in Somalia was interrupted for a second day on Monday as traders protested the introduction of a sales tax, a key reform for the Horn of Africa nation’s government that secured a $100 million lifeline from the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 印度帕特拉称过早宽松将使通胀失控
item.description: 印度储备银行副行长迈克尔-帕特拉（Michael Patra）表示，食品价格的反复冲击正在推高印度的通货膨胀率，如果过早放松货币政策，通货膨胀率可能会 "失控"。【原文：Repeated food price shocks are pushing up India’s inflation rate and it may “run out of control” if monetary policy is eased early, according to Reserve Bank of India Deputy Governor Michael Patra.】

item.title: SPAC 老将克莱因在交易破裂后将关闭另一家空头支票公司
item.description: 华尔街大师迈克尔-克莱因（Michael Klein）的 SPAC 帝国再遭打击，因为将 CorpAcq 控股有限公司上市的交易被取消了。【原文：Wall Street maven Michael Klein’s SPAC empire was dealt another blow when a deal to take CorpAcq Holdings Ltd. public was called off.】

item.title: 伊坎在保证金贷款调查后与美国证券交易委员会达成 200 万美元和解协议
item.description: 亿万富翁卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）及其投资公司同意支付 200 万美元，与美国证券交易委员会达成和解。【原文：Billionaire Carl Icahn and his investment firm have agreed to pay $2 million to settle with the US Securities and Exchange Commission after an investigation by the regulator.】

item.title: 英国科技企业家林奇游艇沉没后失踪
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士称，一艘超级游艇在意大利西西里岛海岸沉没，英国科技企业家迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）是失踪人员之一。【原文：British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch is among the people missing after a superyacht sank off the coast of Sicily, Italy, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 土耳其 Eren 公司为英国新造纸厂获得 8.5 亿美元贷款
item.description: 土耳其工业和零售集团 Eren Holding AS 已获得一笔 7.75 亿欧元（8.54 亿美元）的贷款，用于为威尔士一家价值 13 亿美元的箱板纸和卫生纸厂提供资金，从而推动了外国对英国制造业的直接投资。【原文：Turkish industrial and retail group Eren Holding AS has secured a €775 million ($854 million) loan to finance a $1.3 billion container-board and tissue plant in Wales, in a boost to foreign direct investment in UK manufacturing.】

item.title: Bitwise 收购 ETC 集团，ETF 交易继续进行
item.description: 加密货币交易所交易基金提供商比特慧资产管理公司（Bitwise Asset Management）正在收购一家位于伦敦的数字资产发行商 ETC Group，为 ETF 行业内的一连串交易锦上添花。【原文：Crypto exchange-traded fund provider Bitwise Asset Management is buying ETC Group, a digital-assets issuer based in London, adding to a spate of deals within the ETF industry.】

item.title: 农业交易商安德森公司任命比尔-克鲁格为首席执行官
item.description: 安德森公司（The Andersons Inc. ）任命比尔-克鲁格（Bill Krueger）为首席执行官，接替帕特-伯尔（Pat Bowe），从 10 月份开始执掌这家面临全球农产品市场疲软的农作物贸易商。【原文：The Andersons Inc. tapped Bill Krueger as chief executive officer, succeeding Pat Bowe beginning in October and taking the reins of the crop trader as it faces weaker global agricultural markets.】

item.title: 肯尼亚航空公司十年来首次实现中期盈利
item.description: 肯尼亚航空公司（Kenya Airways Plc）因客运量和货运量增加，10 年来首次实现上半年盈利。【原文：Kenya Airways Plc posted a first-half profit for the first time in 10 years as it increased passengers and cargo volumes.】

item.title: 摩根大通称在美国重新上市的公司将获得被动型基金的支持
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：European companies that relist in New York tend to see improved valuations, in part due to the prevalence of passive investing in the US, according to an analysis by JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: Palo Alto Networks 的反弹需要强劲的下一步展望
item.description: Palo Alto Networks 公司的股价在过去两周里一路高歌猛进，这主要得益于两家网络安全同行的强劲业绩以及股市的广泛反弹。【原文：Palo Alto Networks Inc. shares have been on a tear over the last two weeks, boosted by strong results from a pair of cybersecurity peers and a broader-based rebound by equity markets.】

item.title: 夏季交易升温，7-Eleven 和 Pop Tarts 掀起并购浪潮
item.description: 在通常平静的夏季，消费行业的两宗巨额交易让银行家们忙得不可开交，这显示出企业界信心的不断增强，有助于交易复苏的延续。【原文：A pair of megadeals in the consumer industry is keeping bankers busy during the normally quiet summer months, showing a rising confidence in the corporate world that’s helping extend a dealmaking revival.】

item.title: 威尔逊球拍制造商 Amer 着眼于中国市场销售，以阻止上市后股价下滑
item.description: Amer Sports Inc. 自今年早些时候上市以来一直令投资者失望，股价自 2 月份上市以来下跌了近 12%。周二，这种情况可能会改变，华尔街希望通过其最新财报来重振该股。【原文：Amer Sports Inc. has been a disappointment for investors since going public earlier this year, with shares sliding nearly 12% since its February debut. That could change Tuesday, with Wall Street looking to its latest earnings to revive the stock.】

item.title: 交易商关注西非作物前景，可可价格攀升
item.description: 可可在纽约上涨，原因是交易商关注主要西非种植者的生产前景。【原文：Cocoa rose in New York as traders focused on prospects for production key West African growers.】

item.title: 以色列谢克尔下滑，波动性因难以实现的停火协议而飙升
item.description: 以色列谢克尔周一大幅下跌，该国债券收益率跃升至8月1日以来的最高点，原因是难以实现的停火和新一轮的局势升级威胁令投资者惶惶不安。【原文：Israel’s shekel slumped on Monday and the nation’s bond yields jumped to the highest since Aug. 1 as an elusive cease-fire and a renewed threat of escalation kept investors on edge.】

item.title: 巨型超级油轮运送燃料，欧洲面临柴油洪峰
item.description: 随着通常运输原油的巨型油轮从千里之外的中东卸下大量精炼燃料，大量柴油涌入欧洲。【原文：A flood of diesel is arriving in Europe as giant tankers that would normally transport crude oil instead discharge large cargoes of the refined fuel from thousands of miles away in the Middle East.】

item.title: 中国法院受理针对恒大集团的清算听证会
item.description: 本月早些时候，中国大陆一家法院受理了针对中国恒大集团旗下一家公司的清算申请，从而触发了正式的法律程序，加大了对这家违约开发商的压力，要求其要么重组，要么在最坏的情况下面临主要运营基地的清算。【原文：A mainland Chinese court accepted a liquidation application filed against a China Evergrande Group unit earlier this month, triggering a formal legal process that ratchets up the pressure on the defaulted developer to either restructure or face liquidation in its main base of operations under a worst-case scenario.】

item.title: 高盛 AM 为 SLR 咨询公司准备 10 亿英镑私人债务
item.description: 知情人士透露，高盛资产管理公司正牵头与一批私人信贷借贷机构进行谈判，为环境咨询公司 SLR Consulting 提供约 7.5 亿英镑（9.71 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management is leading a group of private credit lenders in talks to provide about £750 million ($971 million) to environmental advisory firm SLR Consulting, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 香港长江基建伦敦首秀交易清淡
item.description: 长江基建控股有限公司（CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd.）的股票在伦敦首次上市时交易清淡，这是根据旨在吸引外国发行商到英国首都上市的新规则进行的首次大规模上市。【原文：CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd. shares saw light trading on their London debut, in the first major listing under new rules meant to lure foreign issuers to the British capital.】
